String.Source: Remember what our great grandparents always taught us: Make sure your windows are as solid as your education! Don't read too much into this old saying or it won't make any sense. The point is that these windows are as solid as the rock that they're made from, and that you should stay in school.
String.Dest: Remember what our great grandparents always taught us: Make sure your windows are as solid as your education! Don't read too much into this old saying or it won't make any sense. The point is that these windows are as solid as the rock that they're made from, and that you should stay in school.

String.Source: Watson Beecham, inventor of the double-silled window was educated at our very own University of Britechester. Beecham operated under the thought process that more was more, so why not have twice the window sill? Eureka!
String.Dest: Watson Beecham, inventor of the double-silled window was educated at our very own University of Britechester. Beecham operated under the thought process that more was more, so why not have twice the window sill? Eureka!

String.Source: Double the Fun Double Silled Window
String.Dest: Double the Fun Double Silled Window

String.Source: What's better than a double silled window? A double-double silled window! That's right. Two windows and two sills are better than one. Let the vitamin D shine in!
String.Dest: What's better than a double silled window? A double-double silled window! That's right. Two windows and two sills are better than one. Let the vitamin D shine in!

String.Source: Make your future as clear and bright as these windows! Go to college! Study art! Have your cinematic arts professor constantly complain to the class about their divorce, and then give a C- on a Film Noir paper that you still think deserved at least a B. Yes, as you gaze into the windows, remember: dreams do come true!
String.Dest: Make your future as clear and bright as these windows! Go to college! Study art! Have your cinematic arts professor constantly complain to the class about their divorce, and then give a C- on a Film Noir paper that you still think deserved at least a B. Yes, as you gaze into the windows, remember: dreams do come true!

String.Source: No matter how into test-taking, book-worming, and information-spongeing you are, there's a little clock-watcher in all of us. Instead of waiting to be saved by the bell, turn your attentions toward the outside world with this watchful window. Give the illusion that you're really into nature rather than slowly dying inside from the pressure of assignments and crushing responsibility. Look! A happy squirrel!
String.Dest: No matter how into test-taking, book-worming, and information-spongeing you are, there's a little clock-watcher in all of us. Instead of waiting to be saved by the bell, turn your attentions toward the outside world with this watchful window. Give the illusion that you're really into nature rather than slowly dying inside from the pressure of assignments and crushing responsibility. Look! A happy squirrel!

String.Source: Diamonds! Rhombuses! Two triangles stacked on top of each other which also forms a diamond! These windows have all these shapes and more since the windows themselves are square AND rectangular. Functional geometry at work!
String.Dest: Diamonds! Rhombuses! Two triangles stacked on top of each other which also forms a diamond! These windows have all these shapes and more since the windows themselves are square AND rectangular. Functional geometry at work!

String.Source: Fun fact: Britechester's original dean had a pet pigeon named Piggy who would attend meetings, social functions, and nap outside the dean's window when he wasn't scanning the halls for crumbs. Now you can have Piggy the Pigeon's favorite perch!
String.Dest: Fun fact: Britechester's original dean had a pet pigeon named Piggy who would attend meetings, social functions, and nap outside the dean's window when he wasn't scanning the halls for crumbs. Now you can have Piggy the Pigeon's favorite perch!

String.Source: This sweetly subtle capped jamb design harkens back to old schoolhouses, back when students brought apples to teachers. The good ole days when teachers wouldn't have to try to learn slang, rap or sit in a backwards chair to get their student's attention.
String.Dest: This sweetly subtle capped jamb design harkens back to old schoolhouses, back when students brought apples to teachers. The good ole days when teachers wouldn't have to try to learn slang, rap or sit in a backwards chair to get their student's attention.

String.Source: The finest specimen in windows! This window out-ranked all other windows in the standardized window regulatory exam, and even answered all extra credit questions correctly. Some accused the window of cheating by reflecting the answers to the tests of it's neighbors, but if you ask us, any window that's smart enough to cheat on a test deserves an A.
String.Dest: The finest specimen in windows! This window out-ranked all other windows in the standardized window regulatory exam, and even answered all extra credit questions correctly. Some accused the window of cheating by reflecting the answers to the tests of it's neighbors, but if you ask us, any window that's smart enough to cheat on a test deserves an A.

String.Source: This window adorns the walls of the Foxbury Institute's server room, keeping them at a nice, chilled temperature while still letting the server engineers see the outside world still exists beyond the pile of empty coffee mugs and chip bags.
String.Dest: This window adorns the walls of the Foxbury Institute's server room, keeping them at a nice, chilled temperature while still letting the server engineers see the outside world still exists beyond the pile of empty coffee mugs and chip bags.

String.Source: A Study in Insulation Double Silled Window
String.Dest: A Study in Insulation Double Silled Window

String.Source: Cooped up in classes all day? Mentally get away -- even just for a moment! Remember, the sun is still shining even though you're stuck inside trying to figure out what you're going to do with your life and learning how to be a productive member of society. Take a gander and find your own private ray of sun!
String.Dest: Cooped up in classes all day? Mentally get away -- even just for a moment! Remember, the sun is still shining even though you're stuck inside trying to figure out what you're going to do with your life and learning how to be a productive member of society. Take a gander and find your own private ray of sun!

String.Source: Gone are the times of convention. The future is clear: bold window choices! Adorn your institute with these one-of-a-kind windows that'll be sure to turn heads. Don't be a square, man. Make your shanty slanty!
String.Dest: Gone are the times of convention. The future is clear: bold window choices! Adorn your institute with these one-of-a-kind windows that'll be sure to turn heads. Don't be a square, man. Make your shanty slanty!

String.Source: The Future is Diagonal Window Left
String.Dest: The Future is Diagonal Window Left

String.Source: Okay, so the future isn't 100% unconventional. Turns out people will still need both left and right windows. I mean, this isn't design anarchy...yet! Either way, the future is still bold window choices! Make your shanty slanty!
String.Dest: Okay, so the future isn't 100% unconventional. Turns out people will still need both left and right windows. I mean, this isn't design anarchy...yet! Either way, the future is still bold window choices! Make your shanty slanty!

String.Source: The Future is Diagonal Window Right
String.Dest: The Future is Diagonal Window Right

String.Source: This window means business! The etched glass pane is framed with beveled metal and solid oak for extra swank. Built to withstand natural disasters, and naturally destructive, angsty students.
String.Dest: This window means business! The etched glass pane is framed with beveled metal and solid oak for extra swank. Built to withstand natural disasters, and naturally destructive, angsty students.

String.Source: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick crown, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, as long as you don't mind the somewhat small dimensions...
String.Dest: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick crown, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, as long as you don't mind the somewhat small dimensions...

String.Source: Brick Accented Square Window - By Eleanor Bricksby
String.Dest: Brick Accented Square Window - By Eleanor Bricksby

String.Source: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick arch accent, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, not a bad size too!
String.Dest: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick arch accent, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, not a bad size too!

String.Source: Brick Arch Accent Rectangular Window - By Eleanor Bricksby
String.Dest: Brick Arch Accent Rectangular Window - By Eleanor Bricksby

String.Source: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick arch accent, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, not a bad size too!
String.Dest: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. With its eye catching, elegant brick arch accent, this window is perfect for people watching of all sorts, not a bad size too!

String.Source: Brick Accented Circletop Window - By Eleanor Bricksby
String.Dest: Brick Accented Circletop Window - By Eleanor Bricksby

String.Source: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. A bit more modest than the other models, this particular version is definitely suited for the more austere homeowner that wants that simpler look.
String.Dest: Give your home a touch of that old town feel with a brick accented Eleanor Bricksby window. A bit more modest than the other models, this particular version is definitely suited for the more austere homeowner that wants that simpler look.

String.Source: Brick Accented Rectangular Window - By Eleanor Bricksby
String.Dest: Brick Accented Rectangular Window - By Eleanor Bricksby

String.Source: The Dean's pet pigeon Piggy has an entourage of two whom the students named Charm and Clarity. This window is their favorite perch! If it's good enough for a pigeon entourage, it's good enough for most. At least...if you're also a pigeon.
String.Dest: The Dean's pet pigeon Piggy has an entourage of two whom the students named Charm and Clarity. This window is their favorite perch! If it's good enough for a pigeon entourage, it's good enough for most. At least...if you're also a pigeon.

String.Source: For those hot days when you wish you'd done better in your statistics class so you wouldn't need to retake the course in summer school. Seriously, what are the odds of that happening?!
String.Dest: For those hot days when you wish you'd done better in your statistics class so you wouldn't need to retake the course in summer school. Seriously, what are the odds of that happening?!

String.Source: Before laptops and central air, there were notebooks and shuttered windows. The times are changing, but that doesn't mean we can't appreciate designs of the good ole days. Takin' it back, old-school!
String.Dest: Before laptops and central air, there were notebooks and shuttered windows. The times are changing, but that doesn't mean we can't appreciate designs of the good ole days. Takin' it back, old-school!

String.Source: If you're smitten with the Charm and Clarity windows but don't have the space, fear not! Science students at Foxbury Institute invented a shrinking ray to minimize the original Charm and Clarity window into a compact version. We know what you're thinking, "A shrinking ray?! Why not use it for something more important, like shrinking a door or a chair?" One thing at a time, friends!
String.Dest: If you're smitten with the Charm and Clarity windows but don't have the space, fear not! Science students at Foxbury Institute invented a shrinking ray to minimize the original Charm and Clarity window into a compact version. We know what you're thinking, "A shrinking ray?! Why not use it for something more important, like shrinking a door or a chair?" One thing at a time, friends!

String.Source: A master's degree in style! These double arched inlay windows provide the perfect posh accent to any academic establishment looking to one-up its competition.
String.Dest: A master's degree in style! These double arched inlay windows provide the perfect posh accent to any academic establishment looking to one-up its competition.

String.Source: Give your students a wide view of the world with this panoramic window. Perfect for providing students with more sunlight, and lovely campus scenery. Bird scraper not included.
String.Dest: Give your students a wide view of the world with this panoramic window. Perfect for providing students with more sunlight, and lovely campus scenery. Bird scraper not included.

String.Source: Tired of looking at your phone screen? We're offering a radical new alternative: looking out the window instead! This panoramic window offers stunning views of the real outdoors. No blue light blocking glasses needed!
String.Dest: Tired of looking at your phone screen? We're offering a radical new alternative: looking out the window instead! This panoramic window offers stunning views of the real outdoors. No blue light blocking glasses needed!

String.Source: Tired of looking at your phone screen? We're offering a radical new alternative: looking out the window instead! This panoramic window offers stunning views of the real outdoors. No blue light blocking glasses needed!
String.Dest: Tired of looking at your phone screen? We're offering a radical new alternative: looking out the window instead! This panoramic window offers stunning views of the real outdoors. No blue light blocking glasses needed!

String.Source: Donated by Britechester's premiere family of alumni snoots: the Waggledorfs. This ostentatiously arched window is a clear sign of class. Slightly distressed as the window has been in the Waggledorf family for hundreds of years and seen a lot of scandals involving monocles.
String.Dest: Donated by Britechester's premiere family of alumni snoots: the Waggledorfs. This ostentatiously arched window is a clear sign of class. Slightly distressed as the window has been in the Waggledorf family for hundreds of years and seen a lot of scandals involving monocles.

String.Source: Rumor has it the last dean of the campus blew the window budget on this impractically lavish bay window so they could install it in the classroom of their secret lover, a science professor at Foxbury Institute. Unfortunately the dean was found out and the window was repossessed. Now it can be yours! How romantic!
String.Dest: Rumor has it the last dean of the campus blew the window budget on this impractically lavish bay window so they could install it in the classroom of their secret lover, a science professor at Foxbury Institute. Unfortunately the dean was found out and the window was repossessed. Now it can be yours! How romantic!

String.Source: Bay Window for my Bae Window
String.Dest: Bay Window for my Bae Window

String.Source: If you're crippled by indecision and not sure which set of windows to pick, we're here to shed some light on your decision. This classic shuttered window is... well... a window. And sometimes that's all you need to know! There's nothing fancy about it, it just works.
String.Dest: If you're crippled by indecision and not sure which set of windows to pick, we're here to shed some light on your decision. This classic shuttered window is... well... a window. And sometimes that's all you need to know! There's nothing fancy about it, it just works.

String.Source: This cottage sitting on the edge of campus was rumored to once be the home of Felix Psyded, founder of the University of Britechester. The cozy home has been updated through the years for student housing so that some could have a house away from home.
String.Dest: This cottage sitting on the edge of campus was rumored to once be the home of Felix Psyded, founder of the University of Britechester. The cozy home has been updated through the years for student housing so that some could have a house away from home.

String.Source: Wyvern Hall has an all out feud with Drake Hall over who more exemplifies the spirit of Darby, Britechester's mascot. Of course for those that live in Wyvern Hall there is no question which is the superior dorm.
String.Dest: Wyvern Hall has an all out feud with Drake Hall over who more exemplifies the spirit of Darby, Britechester's mascot. Of course for those that live in Wyvern Hall there is no question which is the superior dorm.

String.Source: Julia and Becca have been the best of friends since they first met in kindergarten. Nobody that knows them could imagine them going to university without the other one by her side. Now as they're starting a whole new journey into university it's up to the pair to see if their friendship will survive this new adventure and carry them through to adulthood.
String.Dest: Julia and Becca have been the best of friends since they first met in kindergarten. Nobody that knows them could imagine them going to university without the other one by her side. Now as they're starting a whole new journey into university it's up to the pair to see if their friendship will survive this new adventure and carry them through to adulthood.

String.Source: Drake Hall is the best dorm on campus no matter what those Wyvern Hall students say. With the best view of campus from their balcony, the students that live here have nothing to complain about.
String.Dest: Drake Hall is the best dorm on campus no matter what those Wyvern Hall students say. With the best view of campus from their balcony, the students that live here have nothing to complain about.

String.Source: Darby's Den is the best location on campus to fuel up before the big exam, work on homework, and make new friends. The evening tea and poetry readings are a hit with the students, and nobody can withstand watching the great debates that have occurred here. It's snug and comfy, just right for the den of the Britechester Dragons.
String.Dest: Darby's Den is the best location on campus to fuel up before the big exam, work on homework, and make new friends. The evening tea and poetry readings are a hit with the students, and nobody can withstand watching the great debates that have occurred here. It's snug and comfy, just right for the den of the Britechester Dragons.

String.Source: As one of the two prime locations in Gibbs Hill, Spring Steppes is a lush location with great views of the canals and an easy trip to both the bar and library.
String.Dest: As one of the two prime locations in Gibbs Hill, Spring Steppes is a lush location with great views of the canals and an easy trip to both the bar and library.

String.Source: Ekram and Eleanore have lived in Gibbs Hill all their lives from young love, to a growing family, and finally into retirement. Eleanore loves seeing the new students appear each term, but Ekram isn't always as fond of the young adults taking over their quiet town. Recently the couple's teenage grandson, Rohan, came to live with them as he prepares to go to university soon. Rohan will soon finish high school and have to make his final decision on what university he wants to attend.
String.Dest: Ekram and Eleanore have lived in Gibbs Hill all their lives from young love, to a growing family, and finally into retirement. Eleanore loves seeing the new students appear each term, but Ekram isn't always as fond of the young adults taking over their quiet town. Recently the couple's teenage grandson, Rohan, came to live with them as he prepares to go to university soon. Rohan will soon finish high school and have to make his final decision on what university he wants to attend.

String.Source: The prominent half of the spacious two lot complex, Mossy Lane is an idyllic location beneath beautiful blue skies, and an impossible location to forget.
String.Dest: The prominent half of the spacious two lot complex, Mossy Lane is an idyllic location beneath beautiful blue skies, and an impossible location to forget.

String.Source: Angela and Lilith Pleasant have moved into an old family home located in Gibbs Hill to attend the prestigious universities in Britechester. It will be a true test to find out whether their bond as twins can overcome their differences. Their majors have already split them into separate universities, but whether they will be at odds or work together to make it through is a new challenge in their life.
String.Dest: Angela and Lilith Pleasant have moved into an old family home located in Gibbs Hill to attend the prestigious universities in Britechester. It will be a true test to find out whether their bond as twins can overcome their differences. Their majors have already split them into separate universities, but whether they will be at odds or work together to make it through is a new challenge in their life.

String.Source: Nothing seems quite real about Honeydew Fields, but staying here forever feels like a real possibility. With the nearby Pepper's Pub and Laurel Library, Honeydew Fields is a great location for those on a budget who don't mind a bit of hustle and bustle from being close to the center of town.
String.Dest: Nothing seems quite real about Honeydew Fields, but staying here forever feels like a real possibility. With the nearby Pepper's Pub and Laurel Library, Honeydew Fields is a great location for those on a budget who don't mind a bit of hustle and bustle from being close to the center of town.

String.Source: Pepper's Pub has been serving the universities of Britechester for as long as they've been around. The drinks are cheap to keep the college students coming in, and they've become a home for the many organizations that have been formed over time.
String.Dest: Pepper's Pub has been serving the universities of Britechester for as long as they've been around. The drinks are cheap to keep the college students coming in, and they've become a home for the many organizations that have been formed over time.

String.Source: Laurel Library sits at the top of Gibbs Hill, a proud and prominent fixture of the town. Students from all around have used this library forever as a place to study, research, and find a little quiet away from their universities.
String.Dest: Laurel Library sits at the top of Gibbs Hill, a proud and prominent fixture of the town. Students from all around have used this library forever as a place to study, research, and find a little quiet away from their universities.

String.Source: The Foxbury commons, fondly referred to as Larry's Lagoon, is the perfect place for students to recharge after a long day of classes. There's food, and lots of space to study or work on homework when students are tired of dealing with their roommates. Computers and Robotics Workstations gives everyone a chance to use the latest technology to get kickstart to a new term.
String.Dest: The Foxbury commons, fondly referred to as Larry's Lagoon, is the perfect place for students to recharge after a long day of classes. There's food, and lots of space to study or work on homework when students are tired of dealing with their roommates. Computers and Robotics Workstations gives everyone a chance to use the latest technology to get kickstart to a new term.

String.Source: Foxbury Institute is aware that dorms are not the preferred living choice for all students, so they have built a few houses on campus for those that prefer a more homey living style.
String.Dest: Foxbury Institute is aware that dorms are not the preferred living choice for all students, so they have built a few houses on campus for those that prefer a more homey living style.

String.Source: Briny Tower is great starter housing for incoming Freshmen. With a new friend in each room and an overlooking view of the whole campus it is one of the best introductions to university life a student could ask for.
String.Dest: Briny Tower is great starter housing for incoming Freshmen. With a new friend in each room and an overlooking view of the whole campus it is one of the best introductions to university life a student could ask for.

String.Source: Cameron Fletcher is all about learning new things at school, he's just not sure how to make friends with the people around him. But with just a little nudge in the right direction Cameron is sure to master university life.
String.Dest: Cameron Fletcher is all about learning new things at school, he's just not sure how to make friends with the people around him. But with just a little nudge in the right direction Cameron is sure to master university life.

String.Source: Tidal Tower is one of the twin dorms at Foxbury Institute. This top floor housing is highly coveted by returning students particularly for its single room dorm and peak views of the Foxbury campus.
String.Dest: Tidal Tower is one of the twin dorms at Foxbury Institute. This top floor housing is highly coveted by returning students particularly for its single room dorm and peak views of the Foxbury campus.

String.Source: The Sprites bestow their good favor if you help tend to their sacred plants or if you give them their favorite offerings. They also always get a good laugh out of eavesdropping on Sims' Mischievous, Funny, or Romantic conversations.

String.Dest: Ask How to Make the Sprites Happy

String.Source: Oh? Er... Why yes, yes, we were just having our midnight Gardening Club meet. Yes, gardening! Nothing special going on here, tra la la - just some boring old hams watering some plants. Oh, look at the time!
String.Dest: Oh? Er... Why yes, yes, we were just having our midnight Gardening Club meet. Yes, gardening! Nothing special going on here, tra la la - just some boring old hams watering some plants. Oh, look at the time!

String.Source: The Sprites were mistreated by their first human friend, the one they trusted the most. It's taken a long time for them to regain their faith in us. The Order of Enchantment's mission is to protect the Sprites and keep them happy.

String.Source: The Haunted Halls of the University of Britechester Felix Psyded was the enthusiastic entrepreneur who spearheaded the construction of Britechester's first historic university. He was a jubilant man who spread laughter and joy everywhere he went. It was his laughter, tragically, that led to his untimely death during an exceptionally raucous pep rally. Though legend has it, he never actually left his beloved university. Some say that if you listen closely you can still hear his eerie laughter echoing the halls of Britechester. It seems the Felix Psyded is still excited about life, even in death.
String.Dest: The Haunted Halls of the University of Britechester Felix Psyded was the enthusiastic entrepreneur who spearheaded the construction of Britechester's first historic university. He was a jubilant man who spread laughter and joy everywhere he went. It was his laughter, tragically, that led to his untimely death during an exceptionally raucous pep rally. Though legend has it, he never actually left his beloved university. Some say that if you listen closely you can still hear his eerie laughter echoing the halls of Britechester. It seems the Felix Psyded is still excited about life, even in death.

String.Source: The Chilling Tale of Lobster Larry Foxbury Institute's beloved Lobster Mascot is known as a lighthearted, loving and silly shellfish. Many would be shocked to learn of the unthinkable carnage from which his inspiration was derived. Though neither lobster nor Komodo dragon are local to the area, one fateful day in early construction of the university, both beasts were brought together in a most ruthless showdown. As fate would have it, a freak monsoon at sea and a disastrous shipping mishap found both contenders smack in the middle of what is known today as the Foxbury Quad. Having never encountered animals like each other in the wild before, their survival instincts took them swinging head-to-head in an epic crustaceo-lizard death match. Most of the horrified onlookers feared the tiny lobster was no match for the towering venomous dragon, but when all was said and done, it was the lobster who emerged the sole victor. And so forever cemented the fierce rivalry between Dragon and Lobster.
String.Dest: The Chilling Tale of Lobster Larry Foxbury Institute's beloved Lobster Mascot is known as a lighthearted, loving and silly shellfish. Many would be shocked to learn of the unthinkable carnage from which his inspiration was derived. Though neither lobster nor Komodo dragon are local to the area, one fateful day in early construction of the university, both beasts were brought together in a most ruthless showdown. As fate would have it, a freak monsoon at sea and a disastrous shipping mishap found both contenders smack in the middle of what is known today as the Foxbury Quad. Having never encountered animals like each other in the wild before, their survival instincts took them swinging head-to-head in an epic crustaceo-lizard death match. Most of the horrified onlookers feared the tiny lobster was no match for the towering venomous dragon, but when all was said and done, it was the lobster who emerged the sole victor. And so forever cemented the fierce rivalry between Dragon and Lobster.

String.Source: The Mysteries of the Statues There's a popular superstition about the iconic statues for The University of Britechester and The Foxbury Institute. It's rumored that If students offer the right kind of gifts to their respective statues, it could improve their luck with grades and academic success. There's no perfect science to it, but high-quality or rare offerings of collectables like crystals, harvestables, metals, or desserts seem to be the best bet if you're looking to up your academic mojo.
String.Dest: The Mysteries of the Statues There's a popular superstition about the iconic statues for The University of Britechester and The Foxbury Institute. It's rumored that If students offer the right kind of gifts to their respective statues, it could improve their luck with grades and academic success. There's no perfect science to it, but high-quality or rare offerings of collectables like crystals, harvestables, metals, or desserts seem to be the best bet if you're looking to up your academic mojo.

String.Source: The End of an Era In The Order of Enchantment's second year, their founder Esther Mudget was speaking at a charity auction about the importance of using all-natural ingredients for baking. Why she chose that discussion topic in the first place for this particular event is a separate mystery. Midway through this infamous speech, Ms. Mudget abruptly and dramatically ran off into the woods, leaving the auction-goers baffled. It was later revealed internally among the Society that she had overused and betrayed the Sprites, seemingly ignoring their pleas for entertainment and starving them of the sugar they so craved. And all the while had been reaping the academic and social benefits they had bestowed on her. It was her greed and ignorance that ultimately led to her tragic downfall. As legend has it, she is still out there, forever lost, chasing after errant darts of light, hair in a tangled mess. No combs in sight. Esther Mudget's fate serves as a reminder to revere and respect the Sprites lest you incur their wrath.
String.Dest: The End of an Era In The Order of Enchantment's second year, their founder Esther Mudget was speaking at a charity auction about the importance of using all-natural ingredients for baking. Why she chose that discussion topic in the first place for this particular event is a separate mystery. Midway through this infamous speech, Ms. Mudget abruptly and dramatically ran off into the woods, leaving the auction-goers baffled. It was later revealed internally among the Society that she had overused and betrayed the Sprites, seemingly ignoring their pleas for entertainment and starving them of the sugar they so craved. And all the while had been reaping the academic and social benefits they had bestowed on her. It was her greed and ignorance that ultimately led to her tragic downfall. As legend has it, she is still out there, forever lost, chasing after errant darts of light, hair in a tangled mess. No combs in sight. Esther Mudget's fate serves as a reminder to revere and respect the Sprites lest you incur their wrath.

String.Source: The Order's Origin The Sprites on which the Origin of Enchantment's existence is based had been virtually undiscovered by humans until the turn of the century. A chance encounter with an energetic young scientist by the name of Esther Mudget changed the face of history forever. Esther had been studying the pollination patterns of wild mushrooms and her research brought her to Gibbs Hill. This is where she encountered the most fascinating spiral configuration of fungi behind the castle ruins. Intrigued, she began to spend increasingly more of her time there to study. One afternoon, thanks to her polite new neighbors, she brought a slice of fresh fruitcake to the mushroom site. She set the cake on nearby rock while she went about her work. Before long, she started to hear a peculiar whistling sound. She knew this sound was not human, so her instincts told her to crack a corny joke in hopes of diffusing a bad situation. Apparently the Sprites liked her joke. And they really liked her fruitcake. The disarmed Sprites came out of hiding and allowed Esther to see them in their true twinkly form. They whispered wisecracks and the mysteries of the universe in her ears. Little did she know this would be the start of a tender, though ill-fated relationship.
String.Dest: The Order's Origin The Sprites on which the Origin of Enchantment's existence is based had been virtually undiscovered by humans until the turn of the century. A chance encounter with an energetic young scientist by the name of Esther Mudget changed the face of history forever. Esther had been studying the pollination patterns of wild mushrooms and her research brought her to Gibbs Hill. This is where she encountered the most fascinating spiral configuration of fungi behind the castle ruins. Intrigued, she began to spend increasingly more of her time there to study. One afternoon, thanks to her polite new neighbors, she brought a slice of fresh fruitcake to the mushroom site. She set the cake on nearby rock while she went about her work. Before long, she started to hear a peculiar whistling sound. She knew this sound was not human, so her instincts told her to crack a corny joke in hopes of diffusing a bad situation. Apparently the Sprites liked her joke. And they really liked her fruitcake. The disarmed Sprites came out of hiding and allowed Esther to see them in their true twinkly form. They whispered wisecracks and the mysteries of the universe in her ears. Little did she know this would be the start of a tender, though ill-fated relationship.

String.Source: We are sorry to inform {0.SimName} that {M0.he}{F0.she} has not been awarded the {1.String} scholarship. Better luck next time!
String.Dest: We are sorry to inform {0.SimName} that {M0.he}{F0.she} has not been awarded the {1.String} scholarship. Better luck next time!

String.Source:
Teen Sims will receive a special info packet from their schools when they can apply to university. All older Sims are welcome to apply at any time via computer, or mailbox.
After applying, Sims will soon receive their application results, which will inform them which distinguished degrees have accepted them as students. Having better high school grades or experience in relevant skills can be a big help in landing a spot in a distinguished degree program. If prospective students aren’t accepted into these programs, however, they are always welcome to earn any of the standard degrees.
Students may then enroll in their first term at our university via computer, or mailbox. The enrollment form will have them choose their university, degree, and housing, before whisking them off to the start of their higher learning adventure!
String.Dest:
Teen Sims will receive a special info packet from their schools when they can apply to university. All older Sims are welcome to apply at any time via computer, or mailbox.
After applying, Sims will soon receive their application results, which will inform them which distinguished degrees have accepted them as students. Having better high school grades or experience in relevant skills can be a big help in landing a spot in a distinguished degree program. If prospective students aren’t accepted into these programs, however, they are always welcome to earn any of the standard degrees.
Students may then enroll in their first term at our university via computer, or mailbox. The enrollment form will have them choose their university, degree, and housing, before whisking them off to the start of their higher learning adventure!

String.Source:
Since grades for university classes are determined by the amount of work done and mastery of the material acquired over the course of an entire term, the university is unable to give students a definitive letter grade until a term is over. However, students can check in with their professors during office hours in their academic buildings or by emailing them at any time to get a sense of how they’re doing.
In general, going to class, doing the homework, studying from textbooks, completing any final paper or presentation, attending office hours, and building the course’s related skill all contribute to getting a higher grade.
String.Dest:
Since grades for university classes are determined by the amount of work done and mastery of the material acquired over the course of an entire term, the university is unable to give students a definitive letter grade until a term is over. However, students can check in with their professors during office hours in their academic buildings or by emailing them at any time to get a sense of how they’re doing.
In general, going to class, doing the homework, studying from textbooks, completing any final paper or presentation, attending office hours, and building the course’s related skill all contribute to getting a higher grade.

String.Source:
If going to university seems like a financial burden, consider applying for scholarships that can help lower the costs dramatically! Teen and older Sims can apply for a large variety of scholarships, though each has different eligibility requirements.
Universities will automatically provide some money to Sims based on how impressive their application is – the more distinguished degrees they’re accepted into, the better the scholarship – but Sims are also encouraged to apply directly for need-based scholarships if their total funds are low, skill-based scholarships if their Sim has spent time building skills, career-based scholarships if they have workplace experience, sports and e-sports scholarships for Sims wanting to be on the team once they’ve enrolled, or grants relating to where they’re living.
Every scholarship a Sim wins will continue to help bring their costs down every term they’re in university as long as there is no gap between terms! Taking time off by not re-enrolling after a term ends will result in the loss of scholarships.
String.Dest:
If going to university seems like a financial burden, consider applying for scholarships that can help lower the costs dramatically! Teen and older Sims can apply for a large variety of scholarships, though each has different eligibility requirements.
Universities will automatically provide some money to Sims based on how impressive their application is – the more distinguished degrees they’re accepted into, the better the scholarship – but Sims are also encouraged to apply directly for need-based scholarships if their total funds are low, skill-based scholarships if their Sim has spent time building skills, career-based scholarships if they have workplace experience, sports and e-sports scholarships for Sims wanting to be on the team once they’ve enrolled, or grants relating to where they’re living.
Every scholarship a Sim wins will continue to help bring their costs down every term they’re in university as long as there is no gap between terms! Taking time off by not re-enrolling after a term ends will result in the loss of scholarships.

String.Source:
Students enroll and register for classes per term at university, with each term lasting a week. Students may choose to take between one and four classes each term. Once a student has passed 12 classes, they will have enough credits to graduate. Terms may begin for a Sim on any day, but the last day of the term will always be on the evening of the fifth weekday. Be sure to turn in any papers and presentations before the end of term!
When a term ends, students are asked if they wish register for the next term. During re-enrollment, students choose the number of classes and where to live for the next term, though they may also change degrees or universities at the expense of some of the credits they’ve earned.
String.Dest:
Students enroll and register for classes per term at university, with each term lasting a week. Students may choose to take between one and four classes each term. Once a student has passed 12 classes, they will have enough credits to graduate. Terms may begin for a Sim on any day, but the last day of the term will always be on the evening of the fifth weekday. Be sure to turn in any papers and presentations before the end of term!
When a term ends, students are asked if they wish register for the next term. During re-enrollment, students choose the number of classes and where to live for the next term, though they may also change degrees or universities at the expense of some of the credits they’ve earned.

String.Source: Britechester is a quiet countryside with two brilliant universities and a small town snugly between them. Find your own place at the University of Britechester or Foxbury Institute, and in your off time you can visit Gibbs Hill, the peaceful town that welcomes both universities within the walls of its canals.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} is nearing the end of teaching a topic the students have been very excited about. They are currently working on their final projects when {M0.he}{F0.she} suddenly receives a directive demanding all normal coursework be stopped to make time for standardized test prep. The students were extremely excited to finish and share their projects! Should {0.SimFirstName} let them finish or drop everything for the test prep?
String.Dest: {0.SimFirstName} is nearing the end of teaching a topic the students have been very excited about. String.Dest: A young new lecturer is trying to impress the board with "innovative hip methods" and talks to others about the broken old school practices while alluding to {0.SimFirstName}'s class. Should {0.SimFirstName} confront or ignore them?

String.Source: The Dean of the University strongly suggests {0.SimFirstName} admit a handful of potential students that all seem to be from the Dean's hometown. On paper, the students seem under-qualified. Should {0.SimFirstName} admit the students, going along with the Dean's possible nepotism, or treat them like ordinary students?
String.Dest: The Dean of the University strongly suggests {0.SimFirstName} admit a handful of potential students that all seem to be from the Dean's hometown. On paper, the students seem under-qualified. Should {0.SimFirstName} admit the students, going along with the Dean's possible nepotism, or treat them like ordinary students?

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} has gotten feedback that one of the tenured professors has "taken an early retirement," scheduling student presentations as half of his classes. Everyone seems to be receiving a passing grade and one of the students even reported that the professor fell asleep during a presentation! The professor has provided over a decade of service. What should {0.SimFirstName} do?
String.Dest: {0.SimFirstName} has gotten feedback that one of the tenured professors has "taken an early retirement," scheduling student presentations as half of his classes. Everyone seems to be receiving a passing grade and one of the students even reported that the professor fell asleep during a presentation! The professor has provided over a decade of service. What should {0.SimFirstName} do?

String.Source: The annual nature research fieldtrip to the park has been canceled due to a sudden and unexpected storm. String.Dest: As it turns out, {0.SimFirstName} was correct. The students were plagiarizing each other (and across multiple classes)! Failing the students taught them a valuable lesson, and the board was pleased with {0.SimFirstName}'s handling of the situation.

String.Dest: The students turn out to be the children of the Dean's hometown friends and many transfer or drop out, unable to handle the academic pressure. An ethics probe is launched due to the large number of dropouts, and {0.SimFirstName} is caught up in it, resulting in a demotion!

String.Dest: The Dean thanks {0.SimFirstName} personally and explains the students are part of an innovative after-school initiative the Dean had helped spearhead. The students not only perform well, but become central figures of the student body!

String.Source: Despite much uneasiness in the remaining faculty, the position is filled by an enthusiastic up and coming professor who helps steer the course towards success. The board recognizes the extraordinary action {0.SimFirstName} had to take and rewards {M0.him}{F0.her} for it.
String.Dest: Despite much uneasiness in the remaining faculty, the position is filled by an enthusiastic up and coming professor who helps steer the course towards success. The board recognizes the extraordinary action {0.SimFirstName} had to take and rewards {M0.him}{F0.her} for it.

String.Dest: The professor takes the talk as a threat and begins to foment rebellion among the faculty while continuing their uninvolved behavior in the classroom. {0.SimFirstName} is sure that other faculty members now give {M0.him}{F0.her} nasty looks when passing in the hall, eroding their working relationships and making {0.SimFirstName}'s job that much harder.

String.Dest: After a short talk, the tenured professor remembers their joy for teaching, reworking the curriculum with more hands-on experience. This late change turns the course around, and {0.SimFirstName} is credited with doing an excellent job with a dicey situation.

String.Source: Who would have guessed that visiting a yarn museum would end up being such a tangled mess? The students were bored and, what's worse, {0.SimFirstName} now has to deal with a handful of angry parents and unsatisfied school board members complaining about unannounced changes in field trip locations. {0.SimFirstName} is going to have to work hard to make up for this blunder.
String.Dest: Who would have guessed that visiting a yarn museum would end up being such a tangled mess? The students were bored and, what's worse, {0.SimFirstName} now has to deal with a handful of angry parents and unsatisfied school board members complaining about unannounced changes in field trip locations. {0.SimFirstName} is going to have to work hard to make up for this blunder.

String.Source: Who knew yarn could be so educational, not to mention fun? The students loved the field trip and seem to learn a lot, pleasing everyone—including the school board. {0.SimFirstName} is hailed as a hero for {F0.her}{M0.his} quick thinking.
String.Dest: Who knew yarn could be so educational, not to mention fun? The students loved the field trip and seem to learn a lot, pleasing everyone—including the school board. {0.SimFirstName} is hailed as a hero for {F0.her}{M0.his} quick thinking.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} drags everyone back into the classroom, despite a chorus of whines and protests. The rest of the day passes ever-so-slowly as the students remain restless, unruly, and distracted. To top it all off, the blame for the clear lack of productivity is placed on {0.SimFirstName}.
String.Dest: {0.SimFirstName} drags everyone back into the classroom, despite a chorus of whines and protests. The rest of the day passes ever-so-slowly as the students remain restless, unruly, and distracted. To top it all off, the blame for the clear lack of productivity is placed on {0.SimFirstName}.

String.Source: The students were initially disappointed, so {0.SimFirstName} plans a last-minute learning game tournament inside the classroom. The class learns, has fun, and the field trip is rescheduled for another day. All in all, a perfect solution! Who's the favorite teacher now?
String.Dest: The students were initially disappointed, so {0.SimFirstName} plans a last-minute learning game tournament inside the classroom. The class learns, has fun, and the field trip is rescheduled for another day. All in all, a perfect solution! Who's the favorite teacher now?

String.Source: Unfortunately, one of the top-level judges for the competition finale is an expert in Rabbithole Theory. She pokes holes all over the essay, upsetting the student and making the school look bad. The blame trickles down all the way to {0.SimFirstName} for choosing this embarrassing essay over the other one.
String.Dest: Unfortunately, one of the top-level judges for the competition finale is an expert in Rabbithole Theory. The blame trickles down all the way to {0.SimFirstName} for choosing this embarrassing essay over the other one.

String.Source: The essay {0.SimFirstName} selected goes on to win first place at the top level of the contest. While the student receives a lot of praise, the school board is delighted {0.SimFirstName} picked 'a winner,' making them look good.
String.Dest: The essay {0.SimFirstName} selected goes on to win first place at the top level of the contest. While the student receives a lot of praise, the school board is delighted {0.SimFirstName} picked 'a winner,' making them look good.

String.Source: The essay is dismissed and scoffed at as tabloid fodder in the final competition. Alien abductions? Really? Afterwards, the school board lectures {0.SimFirstName} for not taking {F0.her}{M0.his} role as a judge very seriously.
String.Dest: The essay is dismissed and scoffed at as tabloid fodder in the final competition. Alien abductions? Really? Afterwards, the school board lectures {0.SimFirstName} for not taking {F0.her}{M0.his} role as a judge very seriously.

String.Source: 'Alien Abductions' may be an outlandish topic, but, to everyone's delight, the finale judges love it all the more for it! The essay is heralded as interesting, informative, and weird, while the safer essays are largely ignored. String.Source: All the time spent practicing with teammates pays off... Without having to say a word, {0.SimFirstName}'s team positions themselves perfectly to intercept the pass, and {M0.he}{F0.she} ends up with the ball.
String.Dest: All the time spent practicing with teammates pays off... Without having to say a word, {0.SimFirstName}'s team positions themselves perfectly to intercept the pass, and {M0.he}{F0.she} ends up with the ball.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} shoves {M0.his}{F0.her} opponent into the ground, critically injuring them. The referee witnessed this and immediately stops play to issue a red card, resulting in {0.SimFirstName} being sent off.
String.Dest: {0.SimFirstName} shoves {M0.his}{F0.her} opponent into the ground, critically injuring them. The referee witnessed this and immediately stops play to issue a red card, resulting in {0.SimFirstName} being sent off.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} moves into position in the nick of time and blocks the opponent's shot... The sting of the ball smacking into {0.SimPronounObjective} is worth it, knowing that {M0.his}{F0.her} sacrifice may have saved a goal.

String.Source: Distracted by {0.SimFirstName}'s yelling, the goalie loses {M0.his}{F0.her} concentration and the opponent scores. Maybe {0.SimFirstName} should simply trust {M0.his}{F0.her} teammates to do their jobs without {M0.his}{F0.her} "help".

String.Source: Piercing passes require perfect timing and execution, and {0.SimFirstName}'s pass is off the mark. An opponent has intercepted the ball and taken off in the other direction.
String.Dest: Piercing passes require perfect timing and execution, and {0.SimFirstName}'s pass is off the mark. An opponent has intercepted the ball and taken off in the other direction.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} threads the needle with {M0.his}{F0.her} piercing pass, rocketing it past two opponents and hitting {M0.his}{F0.her} teammate in stride, who proceeds to score a goal!
String.Dest: {0.SimFirstName} threads the needle with {M0.his}{F0.her} piercing pass, rocketing it past two opponents and hitting {M0.his}{F0.her} teammate in stride, who proceeds to score a goal!

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} sees an open teammate out of the corner of {M0.his}{F0.her} eye, but presses onwards, envisioning {M0.his}{F0.her} moment of glory... {M0.His}{F0.Her} selfish move doesn't pay off; the opponent's goalie has plenty of time to square up and stop {0.SimFirstName}'s shot.

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} chugs the Power-Sip, eagerly anticipating the forthcoming boost of energy. That'll definitely take {0.SimFirstName} off {M0.his}{F0.her} game.

String.Source: Are you consumed by the insatiable need to create? You're not alone! Share that passion with your comrades in the Art Society. Earn Organization progress in your spare time by doing creative Tasks.
String.Dest: Are you consumed by the insatiable need to create? You're not alone! Share that passion with your comrades in the Art Society. Earn Organization progress in your spare time by doing creative Tasks.

String.Source: Use your power of convincing to raise in the ranks of the unabashedly outspoken Debate Guild. Think that was a mouthful? There's more to come. Drop some serious schooling to fellow Debate Guild Members at Debate Practice or leverage the Debate Showdown to tell the world what's up.
String.Dest: Use your power of convincing to raise in the ranks of the unabashedly outspoken Debate Guild. Think that was a mouthful? There's more to come. Drop some serious schooling to fellow Debate Guild Members at Debate Practice or leverage the Debate Showdown to tell the world what's up.

String.Source: The growing brain needs food. And that's no exception for The Brainiacs. This knowledge-hungry and over-achieving Organization meets up for regular Study Sessions at the Library. Gain Extra-Curricular Brainiac points by completing the Tasks below.
String.Dest: The growing brain needs food. And that's no exception for The Brainiacs. This knowledge-hungry and over-achieving Organization meets up for regular Study Sessions at the Library. Gain Extra-Curricular Brainiac points by completing the Tasks below.

String.Source: Party lightly with School Spirit Day or party hard with the Game Day Party! Expect your school’s Lobster Mascot or the Juice Keg to make an appearance at one or both of these gatherings.
String.Dest: Party lightly with School Spirit Day or party hard with the Game Day Party! Expect your school’s Lobster Mascot or the Juice Keg to make an appearance at one or both of these gatherings.

String.Source: The Britechester Spirit Corps has a mission to spread the joy of school cheer in everything they do. They help to make Britechester shine just a bit brighter every day with wholesome high-fives, pepping up other Sims, and taunting that loathed Foxbury Lobster.
String.Dest: The Britechester Spirit Corps has a mission to spread the joy of school cheer in everything they do. They help to make Britechester shine just a bit brighter every day with wholesome high-fives, pepping up other Sims, and taunting that loathed Foxbury Lobster.

String.Source: Tinker alone or tinker with friends! Bot Savants have regular meetups to build robots together or celebrate their latest creations. Gain robo cred on the side and earn Organization points by doing the Robotics Tasks listed below on your free time.
String.Dest: Tinker alone or tinker with friends! Bot Savants have regular meetups to build robots together or celebrate their latest creations. Gain robo cred on the side and earn Organization points by doing the Robotics Tasks listed below on your free time.

String.Source: The secret of the sprites has been held precious for generations. It is truly a gift to be awoken to their blessings. Bestow the sprites with respect (or sweets) and they will graciously return the favor. Snub them and things may not go as well for you.
String.Dest: The secret of the sprites has been held precious for generations. It is truly a gift to be awoken to their blessings. Bestow the sprites with respect (or sweets) and they will graciously return the favor. Snub them and things may not go as well for you.

String.Source:
Research & Debate is all about learning information and then utilizing it—whether that be in a debate or through social influence.
This skill can be improved and used with the Research Archive Machine to Research varying topics, and the Mirror to Practice Debating.

String.Source:
Machine learning algorithms work every day to improve a Servo's functions. Enhancing automatons unlocks new technologies, better battery capacity, and more durable materials.
Enhancement data can be gained from improving one of life's many skills, or by downloading information directly from Servo servers.

String.Source: {0.SimName} has reached: Enhancement Level 6 {F0.Her}{M0.His} system updates allow for an upgraded titanium hull that improves {F0.her}{M0.his} Durability by 25%! {F0.She}{M0.He} can also unlock more Behavior Modules!
String.Dest: {0.SimName} has reached: Enhancement Level 6 {F0.Her}{M0.His} system updates allow for an upgraded titanium hull that improves {F0.her}{M0.his} Durability by 25%! {F0.She}{M0.He} can also unlock more Behavior Modules!

String.Source: {0.SimFirstName} has reached: Enhancement Level 1 {F0.Her}{M0.His} system updates allow {0.SimPronounObjective} to recharge 10% faster! {F0.She}{M0.He} also has the new ability to Download Enhancement Data {0.SimFirstName} can make progress towards {F0.her}{M0.his} next enhancement level by gaining Skill and downloading the latest enhancement updates straight from the global Servo servers!

String.Dest: {0.SimName} has reached: Enhancement Level 4 {F0.Her}{M0.His} system updates allow {0.SimPronounObjective} to utilize high capacity batteries, improving battery life by 10%! {F0.She}{M0.He} can also unlock more Behavior Modules! {0.SimFirstName} has the ability to Toggle Behavior Modules which allows {0.SimPronounObjective} to turn newly unlocked modules on or off.

String.Source: Shape tomorrow's minds with a career in Education. Though, at times, challenging, there are few jobs quite as rewarding.
String.Dest: Shape tomorrow's minds with a career in Education. Though, at times, challenging, there are few jobs quite as rewarding.

String.Source: What can be done when the biological world fails us? Eliminate the flaws with flawless engineering! Visionary Sims in pursuit of a more perfect and logical existence will feel right at home in the Engineering Career.
String.Dest: What can be done when the biological world fails us? Eliminate the flaws with flawless engineering! Visionary Sims in pursuit of a more perfect and logical existence will feel right at home in the Engineering Career.

String.Source: Sims who pursue a career in law are in a unique position to help others with their legal problems, champion causes, and further the public good (or not). That fancy paycheck doesn't hurt either!
String.Dest: Sims who pursue a career in law are in a unique position to help others with their legal problems, champion causes, and further the public good (or not). That fancy paycheck doesn't hurt either!

String.Source:
Research & Debate is all about learning information and then utilizing it—whether that be in a debate or through social influence.
This skill can be improved and used with the Research Archive Machine to Research varying topics, the Computer to Write and Publish Research Papers, the Mirror to Practice Debating, and with other Sims in order to convince them to do certain tasks.
String.Dest:
Research & Debate is all about learning information and then utilizing it—whether that be in a debate or through social influence.
This skill can be improved and used with the Research Archive Machine to Research varying topics, the Computer to Write and Publish Research Papers, the Mirror to Practice Debating, and with other Sims in order to convince them to do certain tasks.

String.Source:
Technology should help make a Sims life better. By creating robots to do chores, protect, and entertain the masses Sims are freed up to do... other Sims specific things!
Robotics Skill is built by Tinkering at the Robotics Table and repairing Utili-Bots and Servos. Increasing this skill unlocks new craftables on the Robotics Table.
String.Dest:
Technology should help make a Sims life better. By creating robots to do chores, protect, and entertain the masses Sims are freed up to do... other Sims specific things!
Robotics Skill is built by Tinkering at the Robotics Table and repairing Utili-Bots and Servos. Increasing this skill unlocks new craftables on the Robotics Table.

String.Source: This Behavior Module allows any Sim family to automate all of their childcare needs the way nature intended. It's almost like children practically raise themselves around Servos with this upgrade.
String.Dest: This Behavior Module allows any Sim family to automate all of their childcare needs the way nature intended. It's almost like children practically raise themselves around Servos with this upgrade.

String.Source: Say goodbye to garbage, spills, and smelly toilets. This Behavior Module upgrades any Servo into a full on Robo-Butler!
String.Dest: Say goodbye to garbage, spills, and smelly toilets. This Behavior Module upgrades any Servo into a full on Robo-Butler!

String.Source: Name a better duo than cold steel and mother nature! With this Behavior Module, mechanical precision surpasses any green thumb!
String.Dest: Name a better duo than cold steel and mother nature! With this Behavior Module, mechanical precision surpasses any green thumb!

String.Source: This Behavior Module turns any Servo into the ultimate party machine! Turn up the music, grab a drink, and party the night away with this upgrade!
String.Dest: This Behavior Module turns any Servo into the ultimate party machine! Turn up the music, grab a drink, and party the night away with this upgrade!

String.Source: Never hire a handyman again! When things start leaking, corroding, and corrupting, forget about it! Any Servo with this Behavior Module will keep clocks ticking.
String.Dest: Never hire a handyman again! When things start leaking, corroding, and corrupting, forget about it! Any Servo with this Behavior Module will keep clocks ticking.

String.Source: With this Behavior Module, any Servo will be fully equipped to defend its softer, squishier family members! Guaranteed to give a Servo prime updates to do away with photo snappers, party crashers, and garlic bashers!
String.Dest: With this Behavior Module, any Servo will be fully equipped to defend its softer, squishier family members! Guaranteed to give a Servo prime updates to do away with photo snappers, party crashers, and garlic bashers!

String.Source: Gain Mental skills at a greater rate
String.Dest: Gain Mental skills at a greater rate

String.Source: As an elite gamer, {0.SimFirstName} has more fun when playing video games, is more likely to win tournaments, and benefits from increased performance within the E-Sports activity.
String.Dest: As an elite gamer, {0.SimFirstName} has more fun when playing video games, is more likely to win tournaments, and benefits from increased performance within the E-Sports activity.

String.Source: (From Reaching Captain in the E-Sports Career)
String.Dest: (From Reaching Captain in the E-Sports Career)

String.Source: Sims can check with their professors via phone or computer to get a sense of how they’re doing in class, though final grades will only be released after the term has ended.
String.Dest: Sims can check with their professors via phone or computer to get a sense of how they’re doing in class, though final grades will only be released after the term has ended.

String.Source: Sims can apply to Scholarships to help pay for university courses or student housing. Scholarships have different requirements; reviewing the Scholarship Info Packet on a computer describes different ways to earn Scholarships.
String.Dest: Sims can apply to Scholarships to help pay for university courses or student housing. Scholarships have different requirements; reviewing the Scholarship Info Packet on a computer describes different ways to earn Scholarships.

String.Source: Sims can get good grades by going to class, doing their homework, studying on textbooks or computers, or practicing skills related to the classes.
String.Dest: Sims can get good grades by going to class, doing their homework, studying on textbooks or computers, or practicing skills related to the classes.

String.Source: Sims can apply to University using the Mailbox or Computer.
String.Dest: Sims can apply to University using the Mailbox or Computer.

String.Source: Sims can see their schedule of classes and final requirements for the term in the Career Panel.
String.Dest: Sims can see their schedule of classes and final requirements for the term in the Career Panel.

String.Source:
When creating a University Housing lot, you will be able to choose a variety of configurations. Most important will be the university that the University Housing is associated with. In addition to the university you will be able to select whether these dorms have gender restrictions, and if roommates should only come from a specific Organization.
Clubs will also be an available option if you own the Get Together Expansion Pack.
String.Dest:
When creating a University Housing lot, you will be able to choose a variety of configurations. Most important will be the university that the University Housing is associated with. In addition to the university you will be able to select whether these dorms have gender restrictions, and if roommates should only come from a specific Organization.
Clubs will also be an available option if you own the Get Together Expansion Pack.

String.Source: Sims should also prepare for their final requirements, which may be a presentation, a term paper, or a final exam.
String.Dest: Sims should also prepare for their final requirements, which may be a presentation, a term paper, or a final exam.

String.Source: Depending on the Sim's skills, they may get accepted into Distinguished Degrees. If your Sim graduates with a Distinguished Degree, they can earn better benefits from their job than normal degrees. Each University specializes in several Distinguished Degrees.
String.Dest: Depending on the Sim's skills, they may get accepted into Distinguished Degrees. If your Sim graduates with a Distinguished Degree, they can earn better benefits from their job than normal degrees. Each University specializes in several Distinguished Degrees.

String.Source: Once a Sim has received acceptance to University, enrollment can be done using a Phone, a Mailbox or a Computer. There are a number of degrees and housing options available for potential students.
String.Dest: Once a Sim has received acceptance to University, enrollment can be done using a Phone, a Mailbox or a Computer. There are a number of degrees and housing options available for potential students.

String.Source: Roommates are an essential part of life, whether Sims are attending University or not! Dorms come packaged with Roommates already but Sims who live off campus and need help with bills can put an Ad out for Roommates through the Computer or Phone.
String.Dest: Roommates are an essential part of life, whether Sims are attending University or not! Dorms come packaged with Roommates already but Sims who live off campus and need help with bills can put an Ad out for Roommates through the Computer or Phone.

String.Source:
Any objects that can go into a Sim's personal inventory can be moved and changed while living on a University Housing lot. These objects can be placed into a Sim's inventory before moving out of their current lot or be purchased by your Sim from the University kiosks that are located in the university neighborhoods.
Note: When looking to redecorate you can rotate these objects using [<] and [>].
String.Dest:
Any objects that can go into a Sim's personal inventory can be moved and changed while living on a University Housing lot. These objects can be placed into a Sim's inventory before moving out of their current lot or be purchased by your Sim from the University kiosks that are located in the university neighborhoods.
Note: When looking to redecorate you can rotate these objects using [<] and [>].

String.Source:
University Housing is a new type of lot where Sims can live while they are attending University. These lots are managed by the universities so there are some restrictions when building these lots.
No ovens or open fire cooking objects will be permitted in University Housing. Additionally once a Sim lives on a University Housing lot there will be no way to make major adjustments to the lot. The only things you'll be able to change are decorations and objects that can be moved in Live mode.
String.Dest:
University Housing is a new type of lot where Sims can live while they are attending University. These lots are managed by the universities so there are some restrictions when building these lots.
No ovens or open fire cooking objects will be permitted in University Housing. Additionally once a Sim lives on a University Housing lot there will be no way to make major adjustments to the lot. The only things you'll be able to change are decorations and objects that can be moved in Live mode.

String.Source: There’s always something happening around campus! Students can join University Organizations to get the most out of their college experience. Each University has their own unique Organizations for enrolled students. Access the Organization Panel from the Social Groups button in the lower right corner of your screen (U).
String.Dest: There’s always something happening around campus! Students can join University Organizations to get the most out of their college experience. Each University has their own unique Organizations for enrolled students. Access the Organization Panel from the Social Groups button in the lower right corner of your screen (U).

String.Source: Once a Sim is part of an Organization, the Organization Panel will show Tasks they can do to earn points toward Organization progress, easy access to their Organization’s scheduled Events, and their current Organization Rank.
String.Dest: Once a Sim is part of an Organization, the Organization Panel will show Tasks they can do to earn points toward Organization progress, easy access to their Organization’s scheduled Events, and their current Organization Rank.

String.Source: From here, you can access information on upcoming Organization Events for your Sims’ University. To join an Organization, have your Sim stop by any of their University’s Events to meet existing Members. Once introduced, your Sim can simply ask any Member if they can join too!
String.Dest: From here, you can access information on upcoming Organization Events for your Sims’ University. To join an Organization, have your Sim stop by any of their University’s Events to meet existing Members. Once introduced, your Sim can simply ask any Member if they can join too!

String.Source: With nearly a millennium of history and tradition, the University of Britechester boasts being the oldest university still teaching today. Originally built as a private academy for vacationing royal families, it has kept many of the original building details that Princess Cordelia helped design in her years there, along with a collection of her diaries about staying at the nearby castle. Nowadays, the university aims to fulfill its mission: molding students into well-rounded, upstanding Sims.
String.Dest: With nearly a millennium of history and tradition, the University of Britechester boasts being the oldest university still teaching today. Originally built as a private academy for vacationing royal families, it has kept many of the original building details that Princess Cordelia helped design in her years there, along with a collection of her diaries about staying at the nearby castle. Nowadays, the university aims to fulfill its mission: molding students into well-rounded, upstanding Sims.

String.Source: The newer of the two universities in Britechester, the Foxbury Institute was established only half a century ago with the help of a generous Landgraab endowment, but already has established itself as a premier place of higher learning. With its striking modern campus, impressive labs and facilities, and litany of alumni who have gone on to storied careers of innovation, the Institute sets out to inspire future generations while teaching students to aim high and dream big.
String.Dest: The newer of the two universities in Britechester, the Foxbury Institute was established only half a century ago with the help of a generous Landgraab endowment, but already has established itself as a premier place of higher learning. With its striking modern campus, impressive labs and facilities, and litany of alumni who have gone on to storied careers of innovation, the Institute sets out to inspire future generations while teaching students to aim high and dream big.

String.Source: An introduction to the world of art history, this course covers paintings through the years and gives students the tools they'll need to succeed in more advanced aspects of art history.
String.Dest: An introduction to the world of art history, this course covers paintings through the years and gives students the tools they'll need to succeed in more advanced aspects of art history.

String.Source: Start your journey into art history with this overview course which will touch on the breadth of art that exists nowadays and explores their origins.
String.Dest: Start your journey into art history with this overview course which will touch on the breadth of art that exists nowadays and explores their origins.

String.Source: Crafting with Canvas is a deeper dive into the techniques used by painters to evoke emotion through their brushstrokes, as well as how painting has evolved as newer tools have emerged on the art scene.
String.Dest: Crafting with Canvas is a deeper dive into the techniques used by painters to evoke emotion through their brushstrokes, as well as how painting has evolved as newer tools have emerged on the art scene.

String.Source: Crafting with Canvas: Paintings through History
String.Dest: Crafting with Canvas: Paintings through History

String.Source: Who decides who a great painter is? Why do we know the names we do? This class delves into the lives of those considered masters of painting, along with their unique techniques.
String.Dest: Who decides who a great painter is? Why do we know the names we do? This class delves into the lives of those considered masters of painting, along with their unique techniques.

String.Source: Brushes with Greatness: An Overview of the Masters
String.Dest: Brushes with Greatness: An Overview of the Masters

String.Source: The true reach of art isn't only those that encounter it. This course examines how famous art influences, shapes, and even drives culture.
String.Dest: The true reach of art isn't only those that encounter it. This course examines how famous art influences, shapes, and even drives culture.

String.Source: Everyone's artistic eye differs, but a student of art history should know what to look for when studying how art has changed over time.
String.Dest: Everyone's artistic eye differs, but a student of art history should know what to look for when studying how art has changed over time.

String.Source: As technology is used to create art that would not be easy - perhaps even impossible - to make before, this course examines what art has been and can be as technology continues to advance.
String.Dest: As technology is used to create art that would not be easy - perhaps even impossible - to make before, this course examines what art has been and can be as technology continues to advance.

String.Source: Was there ever a greater period of artistic revolution than the Renaissance? This class takes a look at a historical period that changed the art world forever.
String.Dest: Was there ever a greater period of artistic revolution than the Renaissance? This class takes a look at a historical period that changed the art world forever.

String.Source: The Renaissance: a Revolution in Art
String.Dest: The Renaissance: a Revolution in Art

String.Source: As wealthy collectors buy and sell art, certain pieces can fetch prices that are large enough that the ripple effects are worth examining.
String.Dest: As wealthy collectors buy and sell art, certain pieces can fetch prices that are large enough that the ripple effects are worth examining.

String.Source: The Force of Art on International Markets
String.Dest: The Force of Art on International Markets

String.Source: Sculpting technique is often discussed, but this course looks at the expression and emotion behind some of art's most famous sculptures.
String.Dest: Sculpting technique is often discussed, but this course looks at the expression and emotion behind some of art's most famous sculptures.

String.Source: This course provides an overview of different schools of modern art, along with a look at the language modern art critics use to talk about that art.
String.Dest: This course provides an overview of different schools of modern art, along with a look at the language modern art critics use to talk about that art.

String.Source: Modern art may feel like a radical departure from classical art, but this course examines the parallels in art and how historical styles and reactions have directly led to certain modern styles.
String.Dest: Modern art may feel like a radical departure from classical art, but this course examines the parallels in art and how historical styles and reactions have directly led to certain modern styles.

String.Source: Modern Art: How Did We Get Here?
String.Dest: Modern Art: How Did We Get Here?

String.Source: Have we always had the desire to create art? What lies behind our creative urges? This course attempts to answer these questions by looking at the earliest evidence of art.
