String.Source: Do we have a deal? Should you take the job? Do you want to go out? Life is full of decisions and it can often feel like we are making them at random. Not so! This course uses the science of psychology to tease out and teach students what mental forces go into each and every decision.
String.Dest: Do we have a deal? Should you take the job? Do you want to go out? Life is full of decisions and it can often feel like we are making them at random. Not so! This course uses the science of psychology to tease out and teach students what mental forces go into each and every decision.

String.Source: The classic trolley problem is about being forced to decide to make a moral decision through a seemingly logical lens. This course uses this classic conundrum to explore the intersection of logic and emotion.
String.Dest: The classic trolley problem is about being forced to decide to make a moral decision through a seemingly logical lens. This course uses this classic conundrum to explore the intersection of logic and emotion.

String.Source: How does the brain deal with risk? This class attempts to break down how we process data about risk, from how we experience risk intellectually versus emotionally to how we deal with cases where low-risk events still happen by coincidence.
String.Dest: How does the brain deal with risk? This class attempts to break down how we process data about risk, from how we experience risk intellectually versus emotionally to how we deal with cases where low-risk events still happen by coincidence.

String.Source: Don't Push the Button: Risk Assessment
String.Dest: Don't Push the Button: Risk Assessment

String.Source: It can be difficult enough to understand how a single mind may work, so throwing a second mind in there raises the ambiguity quite a bit. Every negotiation includes two minds that fluctuate between opposition and agreement. This class attempts to understand the motivations and decision factors that can occur in these tense and changing settings.
String.Dest: It can be difficult enough to understand how a single mind may work, so throwing a second mind in there raises the ambiguity quite a bit. Every negotiation includes two minds that fluctuate between opposition and agreement. This class attempts to understand the motivations and decision factors that can occur in these tense and changing settings.

String.Source: We all believe that most - if not all - of our memories are accurate. This course explodes that myth, using both scientific data to look at the limits of memory in a group of Sims and in-class experiments to show how easy it can be to plant false memories and cast doubt on real ones.
String.Dest: We all believe that most - if not all - of our memories are accurate. This course explodes that myth, using both scientific data to look at the limits of memory in a group of Sims and in-class experiments to show how easy it can be to plant false memories and cast doubt on real ones.

String.Source: When in a debate, negotiation, or other professional argument, it can often seem like the outcome will result in a winner and a loser. This course explores how expanding the mental model of competition to be non-zero-sum has profound implications for how we mentally approach such discussions and even for how well we feel afterwards.
String.Dest: When in a debate, negotiation, or other professional argument, it can often seem like the outcome will result in a winner and a loser. This course explores how expanding the mental model of competition to be non-zero-sum has profound implications for how we mentally approach such discussions and even for how well we feel afterwards.

String.Source: Debates as intellectual challenges date back centuries, but the idea that we can persuade someone else to adopt our point of view is even older. In this class, students will consider the psychological factors that go into winning or losing an argument, along with the mental ways in which we subconsciously reinforce our own views.
String.Dest: Debates as intellectual challenges date back centuries, but the idea that we can persuade someone else to adopt our point of view is even older. In this class, students will consider the psychological factors that go into winning or losing an argument, along with the mental ways in which we subconsciously reinforce our own views.

String.Source: Debate Me: the Psychology of Attitude Change
String.Dest: Debate Me: the Psychology of Attitude Change

String.Source: All of us use words to describe the emotions we feel throughout the day, but the ways in which we experience emotions may be completely different from one another. Students will examine the science behind what our minds are doing when we say that we feel a certain way and attempt to get their bodies to respond differently to the same emotion.
String.Dest: All of us use words to describe the emotions we feel throughout the day, but the ways in which we experience emotions may be completely different from one another. Students will examine the science behind what our minds are doing when we say that we feel a certain way and attempt to get their bodies to respond differently to the same emotion.

String.Source: While it is often thought that emotion and logic are separate and unique parts of our brains, the truth is more nuanced than that. Our brains use logic to handle emotional outbursts while also relying on emotion to make what should be logical decisions. This course explores the balance between these two powerful forces we each carry inside us.
String.Dest: While it is often thought that emotion and logic are separate and unique parts of our brains, the truth is more nuanced than that. Our brains use logic to handle emotional outbursts while also relying on emotion to make what should be logical decisions. This course explores the balance between these two powerful forces we each carry inside us.

String.Source: Using the theory of Maslow's hierarchy of needs, students will go through a thought experiment of imagining virtual versions of themselves with simpler motivations that directly follow the hierarchy. Would these little beings behave similarly enough that they'd be indistinguishable? Would there be any obvious differences in the decision-making capacity between these "beings" and the students themselves?
String.Dest: Using the theory of Maslow's hierarchy of needs, students will go through a thought experiment of imagining virtual versions of themselves with simpler motivations that directly follow the hierarchy. Would these little beings behave similarly enough that they'd be indistinguishable? Would there be any obvious differences in the decision-making capacity between these "beings" and the students themselves?

String.Source: The brain: the last frontier. Even as more advanced tools that allow for greater imaging and analysis of the brain emerge, the theory that drives understanding of what the data shows will always be needed to push the psychology field forward. This course connects the learnings of the past to the possibilities for the future.
String.Dest: The brain: the last frontier. Even as more advanced tools that allow for greater imaging and analysis of the brain emerge, the theory that drives understanding of what the data shows will always be needed to push the psychology field forward. This course connects the learnings of the past to the possibilities for the future.

String.Source: As an introduction the Villainy degree, this course teaches students how to master the basics of tricking and trapping others. By making these second nature, students will be able build off these skills for more advanced villainy courses later.
String.Dest: As an introduction the Villainy degree, this course teaches students how to master the basics of tricking and trapping others. By making these second nature, students will be able build off these skills for more advanced villainy courses later.

String.Source: Every villain has to start somewhere, and with the Minor Pranks and Misdemeanors course, students will learn which small crimes can give them villainous experience without leading to larger consequences before they're ready for them!
String.Dest: Every villain has to start somewhere, and with the Minor Pranks and Misdemeanors course, students will learn which small crimes can give them villainous experience without leading to larger consequences before they're ready for them!

String.Source: In collaboration with the Drama department, this course teaches early Villainy students how to impersonate others. By studying some simple skills, students will find that they can get access to places and goods they'd otherwise miss out on.
String.Dest: In collaboration with the Drama department, this course teaches early Villainy students how to impersonate others. By studying some simple skills, students will find that they can get access to places and goods they'd otherwise miss out on.

String.Source: A good villain plays not only off their own strengths, but also off the weaknesses of whomever they're facing. This course looks at typical weak points someone may possess - both physical and emotional - and offers strategies on how to best exploit them.
String.Dest: A good villain plays not only off their own strengths, but also off the weaknesses of whomever they're facing. This course looks at typical weak points someone may possess - both physical and emotional - and offers strategies on how to best exploit them.

String.Source: A large villainous enterprise should budget for bribes, but nobody wants to spend more than they need to! By studying power structures, this course teaches students how to target specific people for bribes to give them the best bang for buck.
String.Dest: A large villainous enterprise should budget for bribes, but nobody wants to spend more than they need to! By studying power structures, this course teaches students how to target specific people for bribes to give them the best bang for buck.

String.Source: Students lucky enough to become professional villains will often run into so-called professional heroes, who always seem hesitant to reveal their actual name and identity! This course offers tips that allow students through simple observation and deduction to unmask this cowardly "heroes."
String.Dest: Students lucky enough to become professional villains will often run into so-called professional heroes, who always seem hesitant to reveal their actual name and identity! This course offers tips that allow students through simple observation and deduction to unmask this cowardly "heroes."

String.Source: As operations expand, the hiring of underling presents a new challenge. After this course, which explores the ideas of underling unions and benefits, students should feel up to the challenge to maintaining a happy workplace with any number of underlings.
String.Dest: As operations expand, the hiring of underling presents a new challenge. After this course, which explores the ideas of underling unions and benefits, students should feel up to the challenge to maintaining a happy workplace with any number of underlings.

String.Source: Using a popular theory in villainy that any good evil plan must involve many intricate steps that all depend on perfect execution and a bit of luck, students will be tasked with forming some evil plans of their own and questions whether this domino theory still holds true in modern villainy.
String.Dest: Using a popular theory in villainy that any good evil plan must involve many intricate steps that all depend on perfect execution and a bit of luck, students will be tasked with forming some evil plans of their own and questions whether this domino theory still holds true in modern villainy.

String.Source: Using both successful and failed heists of the past, this course has students study the associated building schematics to understand - and even attempt to recreate - the navigating of narrow passages and vents in these crimes.
String.Dest: Using both successful and failed heists of the past, this course has students study the associated building schematics to understand - and even attempt to recreate - the navigating of narrow passages and vents in these crimes.

String.Source: Things go wrong - that's a fact of life. To prepare future villains, this class teaches critical lessons on how to escape from tight situations, with a comparison of different getaway vehicles and a set of lesson on fitting into vents and shafts of various sizes.
String.Dest: Things go wrong - that's a fact of life. To prepare future villains, this class teaches critical lessons on how to escape from tight situations, with a comparison of different getaway vehicles and a set of lesson on fitting into vents and shafts of various sizes.

String.Source: A favorite security system that's survived the tech revolution is the laser maze, which is still surprisingly prevalent around high-value goods. This course breaks down common laser setups, along with exercises students can use to limber up before slipping through such a maze.
String.Dest: A favorite security system that's survived the tech revolution is the laser maze, which is still surprisingly prevalent around high-value goods. This course breaks down common laser setups, along with exercises students can use to limber up before slipping through such a maze.

String.Source: As students progress from simple misdemeanors to larger heists, locations will have more security. This course takes a look at the gamut of modern security protocols and how to elide them, alongside a lesson on effective tunnel-digging.
String.Dest: As students progress from simple misdemeanors to larger heists, locations will have more security. This course takes a look at the gamut of modern security protocols and how to elide them, alongside a lesson on effective tunnel-digging.

String.Source: Everything is connected to the network these days, and that's great news for aspiring villains! This course looks at ways to use this giant network of things to cause chaos and distraction, and teaches the basic skills needed to break into "secure" objects in the wild.
String.Dest: Everything is connected to the network these days, and that's great news for aspiring villains! This course looks at ways to use this giant network of things to cause chaos and distraction, and teaches the basic skills needed to break into "secure" objects in the wild.

String.Source: Anybody can put a fancy chair in a cave and call it a lair, but students of this course will learn the structural needs to build a lair that can expand as your operation grows, along with which government officials will need to be bribed to provide the necessary building permits.
String.Dest: Anybody can put a fancy chair in a cave and call it a lair, but students of this course will learn the structural needs to build a lair that can expand as your operation grows, along with which government officials will need to be bribed to provide the necessary building permits.

String.Source: Between waiting for the perfect moment and for plans in motion to resolve, villains can find themselves wondering how to remain creative and productive. Why not build a Rube Goldberg machine that'll surely raise a villain's brand and profile? This course looks at the mechanics of such machines, along with certain tricks for really catching the public's attention when one goes off.
String.Dest: Between waiting for the perfect moment and for plans in motion to resolve, villains can find themselves wondering how to remain creative and productive. Why not build a Rube Goldberg machine that'll surely raise a villain's brand and profile? This course looks at the mechanics of such machines, along with certain tricks for really catching the public's attention when one goes off.

String.Source: You've taken over the world! Now what? For students who have learned the basics of world domination, this course puts students in the best-case scenario: having to now manage the entire world and keep it dominated. Students will be taught how to effectively delegate and the benefits and detriments of leading through fear.
String.Dest: You've taken over the world! Now what? For students who have learned the basics of world domination, this course puts students in the best-case scenario: having to now manage the entire world and keep it dominated. Students will be taught how to effectively delegate and the benefits and detriments of leading through fear.

String.Source: Like most industries, building and upkeeping a good network of fiends can be important. This course looks at how to make the most villainous first impression, along with how to read someone's body language and decide whether to use a playful approach or an intimidating one.
String.Dest: Like most industries, building and upkeeping a good network of fiends can be important. This course looks at how to make the most villainous first impression, along with how to read someone's body language and decide whether to use a playful approach or an intimidating one.

String.Source: How to Win Fiends & Intimidate People
String.Dest: How to Win Fiends & Intimidate People

String.Source: Villainy can often be a lonely business, and this course aims to proactively tackle to the stigma of mental health issues for many professional villains before it manifests. By having students learn to talk and listen to each other in safe, vulnerable, villain-only spaces, they can learn to find friendships and community that can last beyond graduation.
String.Dest: Villainy can often be a lonely business, and this course aims to proactively tackle to the stigma of mental health issues for many professional villains before it manifests. By having students learn to talk and listen to each other in safe, vulnerable, villain-only spaces, they can learn to find friendships and community that can last beyond graduation.

String.Source: How do you avoid the label of criminal? This course examines the difference between committing a crime and being a villain, and has students explore how to elevate themselves above petty criminal to true villain.
String.Dest: How do you avoid the label of criminal? This course examines the difference between committing a crime and being a villain, and has students explore how to elevate themselves above petty criminal to true villain.

String.Source: Some discount the need for a maniacal laugh, calling it gauche or outdated, but even modern data shows that heroes and citizens consider a good maniacal laugh one of the greatest influencing factors for how villainous someone is. This course focuses on that single aspect of villainy, studying past masters and helping students to find and define their own unique laugh.
String.Dest: Some discount the need for a maniacal laugh, calling it gauche or outdated, but even modern data shows that heroes and citizens consider a good maniacal laugh one of the greatest influencing factors for how villainous someone is. This course focuses on that single aspect of villainy, studying past masters and helping students to find and define their own unique laugh.

String.Source: Why should heroes have all the fun? Using an arsenal of gadgets that have been "borrowed" for this course, students will experiment with different ones to discover how they can be used to disrupt and disturb!
String.Dest: Why should heroes have all the fun? Using an arsenal of gadgets that have been "borrowed" for this course, students will experiment with different ones to discover how they can be used to disrupt and disturb!

String.Source: It's easy to move §1,000,000 between accounts in a wire transfer. Moving §1,000,000 in bags? It requires strength, coordination, and the ability to rethink plans on the fly. This course teaches students different ways to move physical money around, and gives them opportunities to train with different amounts so they can easily tell when something is too light.
String.Dest: It's easy to move §1,000,000 between accounts in a wire transfer. Moving §1,000,000 in bags? It requires strength, coordination, and the ability to rethink plans on the fly. This course teaches students different ways to move physical money around, and gives them opportunities to train with different amounts so they can easily tell when something is too light.

String.Source: In the technology arms race, it can be hard to stay ahead of those using tech for good. By using the robotics lab (but don't tell them we're doing it), this course has students explore how building a robotic suit may enhance the body to do more villainy than was previously possible!
String.Dest: In the technology arms race, it can be hard to stay ahead of those using tech for good. By using the robotics lab (but don't tell them we're doing it), this course has students explore how building a robotic suit may enhance the body to do more villainy than was previously possible!

String.Source: Fighting is risky and almost never an ideal choice, but there are times when villainy requires a bit of scuffling. This course lays out ways to fight effectively, even when students may be saddled with large amounts of money, explosives, or valuable but fragile electronics.
String.Dest: Fighting is risky and almost never an ideal choice, but there are times when villainy requires a bit of scuffling. This course lays out ways to fight effectively, even when students may be saddled with large amounts of money, explosives, or valuable but fragile electronics.

String.Source: Can anyone truly understand art? A degree in Art History will attempt to answer that question! Leveraging skills such as painting, writing, and charisma, Art History students will be able to expand their cultural horizons and also provide fun facts in art museums forever.

String.Source: It really is a matter of life and death! Biology attempts to unlock the mysteries of life through the study of - among other things - the fitness, gardening, and logic skills. A scientific foundation and a Biology degree can truly open your eyes to the world around you.

String.Source: If all the world's a stage, become a better player in it by enrolling in our Drama degree! It's a chance to dig deep into your emotions, find your true self, and let it shine for everyone to see, all while honing your charisma and comedy skills!

String.Source: University Housing is a place for students to live and rest their head while going to University. Each University Housing can be designated for one of Britechester's two prestigious universities.
String.Dest: University Housing is a place for students to live and rest their head while going to University. Each University Housing can be designated for one of Britechester's two prestigious universities.

String.Source: Meet up with the Club at the Student Commons.
String.Dest: Meet up with the Club at the Student Commons.

String.Source: The UBrite Commons is a place for students from the University of Britechester to get food and study. Between classes the UBrite commons hosts a variety of fun activities for the students.

String.Source: This university is the oldest in Britechester, founded by the famous Felix Psyded, who was well known for his enthusiasm for learning and humorously large books. As the years have passed the University of Britechester has established itself as an esteemed institute of classical education.
String.Dest: This university is the oldest in Britechester, founded by the famous Felix Psyded, who was well known for his enthusiasm for learning and humorously large books. As the years have passed the University of Britechester has established itself as an esteemed institute of classical education.

String.Source: Gibbs Hill is nestled in the center of Britechester right between the two universities, Foxbury Institute and the University of Britechester. It was the first center of activity in Britechester and its famous Laurel Library has stayed a key location for many students to study and learn. The Pepper's Pub has also become a common spot for students from all around to make friends regardless of their rivalries.

String.Source: Foxbury Institute may seem young compared to the historical town surrounding it, but it has quickly distinguished itself in academia. For the students who have worked hard to attend Foxbury Institute, it's not just work, but the pursuit of personal passions that keeps this campus bustling.
